intro: Oenothera pilosella var. sessilis, commonly known as the sessile evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as prairies and disturbed areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. The sessile evening primrose is also noted for its ability to attract nocturnal pollinators like moths.
